p: Wagstrom states that the papers fail to “differentiate between potential risks associated with general animal production—regardless of facility type—and risks associated with CAFOs.” As stated in the overview to the Mini-Monograph ( Thorne 2007), this conference was focused on industrialized livestock production because this is how > 85% of the pork and poultry in the United States and western Europe is produced. Of U.S. swine production, 54% occurs in 110 industrialized facilities, each housing > 50,000 hogs, and 78.5% occurs in operations with > 5,000 animals ( U.S. Department of Agriculture 2007).
